item.title: How to use the Clojure REBL with Leiningen, Cider and Emacs
item.description: Note: This set of instructions only work on Clojure 1.10+, Lein 2.9+ and JDK 11+. Also, REBL requires a license for commercial use. I didn’t find a handy reference to getting started with REBL if your primary workflow is Leiningen/nrepl, so here is the series of things I had to do to get the REBL up and running for myself. Download the REBL jar from Cognitect. Use lein-localrepo to install the REBL jar to your m2.

item.title: Compiling and Running Emacs 28 from the native-comp feature branch (Ubuntu 20.04).
item.description: Quick Note: How to compile Emacs 28.0.5 from source with native compilation: https://t.co/29vNNkGQoU Native Comp is the work of Andrea Corallo, compiling emacslisp to native code and making it blazing fast! https://t.co/A9oR5mJC9G — Vedang Manerikar (@vedang) August 23, 2020 The gist of it, building Emacs from Source git clone https://git.savannah.gnu.org/git/emacs.git cd emacs ./autogen.sh ./configure --with-nativecomp # If everything works make # Test the binary src/emacs -Q # Install the binary sudo make install # If you want to re-build from scratch make distclean Problems during Installation Configure fails because libgccjit fails the smoketest Ensure that libgccjit is installed and at the latest version (at this point in time, the latest version is 10)
